meanings.definition: Covered with or resembling drops or droplets.
meanings.sent1: The guttate leaves sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: Her guttate dress looked like it had been kissed by raindrops.
meanings.sent3: The guttate clouds seemed to be playing a game of tag in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The guttate design on the wallpaper made the room feel like a magical forest.
meanings.sent5: The guttate dew on the grass glistened like a field of diamonds.

meanings.definition: A small, drop-like shape or pattern.
meanings.sent1: The artist painted delicate guttate flowers on the canvas.
meanings.sent2: The guttate pattern on the fabric added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent3: The guttate of honey on the toast made it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The guttate of stars in the night sky was a breathtaking sight.
meanings.sent5: The guttate of paint on the palette blended together like a colorful mosaic.
